decks.notes: The main focus of this Legacy combo Dredge deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with dredge cards such as Golgari Grave-Troll and Stinkweed Imp in order to trigger powerful effects like Bridge from Below and create an overwhelming board presence. Utilizing cards like Lion's Eye Diamond and Cabal Therapy for additional resources and disruption, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of creatures and tokens generated from the graveyard. The key strategy is to dredge with efficiency and precision to set up explosive turns and ultimately outpace and outvalue the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to control the board and manipulate the game through card advantage and counter spells. By using powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and versatile creatures like Snapcaster Mage, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent while keeping control of the game. The deck includes efficient removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Terminus, along with powerful counterspells like Force of Will. Back to Basics is included to disrupt opponents who rely on nonbasic lands, and Search for Azcanta provides card selection and card advantage. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements efficiently.

The primary focus of this deck is to control the game through countering and removing opponent's threats while building card advantage. By utilizing efficient card draw and manipulation spells like Brainstorm and Ponder, combined with powerful removal like Swords to Plowshares and Terminus, this deck aims to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of versatile cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Snapcaster Mage provide additional value and flexibility in dealing with various threats. The mana base is configured to support the deck's spellcasting requirements efficiently.

The main concept of this UR Aggro Legacy deck is to utilize low-cost, highly efficient creatures along with burn spells to put pressure on the opponent quickly and aggressively. The deck aims to control the board early on with disruptive spells like Daze and Force of Will, while also dealing direct damage to the opponent with Chain Lightning, Lightning Bolt, and Price of Progress. The deck also includes card draw and manipulation spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to ensure consistency and maximize its aggression. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the deck's color requirements and maximize its tempo.

The deck focuses on using the combo of Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token quickly and efficiently. The deck includes various cards to protect and enable the combo such as Sylvan Safekeeper and Crop Rotation, while also incorporating disruption and card advantage through cards like Hymn to Tourach and Dark Confidant. The deck aims to win the game by creating the powerful Marit Lage token and overwhelming the opponent's defenses.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy through a combination of hand disruption spells like Hymn to Tourach and Thoughtseize, removal spells like Fatal Push and Diabolic Edict, and countermagic such as Force of Will. The deck also relies on card advantage with powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana, the Last Hope, as well as efficient creatures like Baleful Strix and Snapcaster Mage. The deck aims to control the game by managing threats and resources, ultimately outvaluing the opponent and securing a victory through attrition.

This Grixis Control deck focuses on efficient removal and disruption to control the game, while also utilizing card advantage with cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Baleful Strix. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with Hymn to Tourach and Thoughtseize, while also applying pressure with cards like Gurmag Angler and Kolaghan's Command. The deck's mana base is designed to support its powerful spells, with access to all three colors and powerful dual lands. In summary, this deck aims to control the game by disrupting the opponent's strategy and generating card advantage.

This control deck focuses on manipulating the opponent's board and resources through a combination of counterspells, card draw, and removal spells. The key strategy is to maintain card advantage and control the game tempo, ultimately winning through powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. By leveraging powerful spells like Terminus and Force of Will, as well as disruption tools like Back to Basics, the deck aims to out-value and outlast opponents until it can secure a victory with angels from Entreat the Angels or by overwhelming the opponent with card advantage.

The deck focuses on using the combination of Life from the Loam and Punishing Fire to control the board, while also using Chalice of the Void to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck utilizes a mix of creature threats like Knight of the Reliquary and Dark Confidant, along with disruptive spells like Abrupt Decay and Vindicate. The mana base is designed to support the Loam engine with a mix of fetchlands and utility lands like Wasteland and Karakas. Overall, the deck aims to grind out incremental advantages and outvalue the opponent in the long game.

The main focus of this Legacy 1 vs 1 Combo - Dredge deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with dredge cards like Golgari Grave-Troll and Stinkweed Imp. By dredging through the deck, the player can bring back powerful creatures like Ichorid and Prized Amalgam from the graveyard and overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of creatures. Cards like Cabal Therapy and Dread Return help disrupt the opponent's strategy and set up powerful combos to win the game. The goal is to quickly establish a dominant board presence and outpace the opponent for a swift victory.

The main concept of the deck is to cheat out powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn onto the battlefield using the combo of Show and Tell combined with cards like Sneak Attack and Omniscience. The deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with these potent threats, while also utilizing card selection and countermagic to protect the combo pieces. Cunning Wish provides additional flexibility and toolbox options, allowing the deck to adapt to various situations and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck is designed to win through a quick and overwhelming combo finish.

The deck focuses on deploying large and powerful Eldrazi creatures quickly by utilizing lands such as Eye of Ugin and Eldrazi Temple to reduce their cost. It also includes disruption elements like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays and efficient mana usage, while also having some utility cards like Karakas for protection or utility. Additionally, the deck includes mana acceleration with cards like City of Traitors and Ancient Tomb to ramp out threats earlier in the game.

The key concept of this Grixis Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy by using a variety of disruptive spells such as Force of Will, Hymn to Tourach, and Thoughtseize. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana, the Last Hope for card advantage and control. In addition, the deck includes efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Lightning Bolt to deal with threats on the board. The deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent through card advantage and disruption while setting up win conditions like Gurmag Angler and Baleful Strix.

The deck revolves around quickly cheating in powerful creatures like Griselbrand or Emrakul, the Aeons Torn onto the battlefield using Show and Tell or Sneak Attack, often bypassing the cost and requirements to cast them. The deck also includes powerful spells like Omniscience to cast spells for free, as well as various cantrips and counterspells to dig for combo pieces and protect the combo. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with massive creatures and win the game before they can respond effectively.

The main goal of this deck is to quickly assemble a combination of Infect creatures like Glistener Elf and Blighted Agent, along with pump spells like Berserk and Become Immense, to deal 10 poison counters to the opponent. The deck also has protection cards like Vines of Vastwood, Spell Pierce, Force of Will, and Daze to ensure the combo goes off without a hitch. The mana base consists of fetch lands like Windswept Heath and Misty Rainforest, along with mana dorks like Noble Hierarch, to enable the deck to function smoothly and consistently.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly apply pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Stormchaser Mage, and Delver of Secrets, while utilizing cheap and powerful burn spells like Chain Lightning, Lightning Bolt, and Risk Factor to either control the board or finish off the opponent. The deck also includes card filtering effects such as Ponder, Preordain, and Brainstorm to ensure consistency, while running counter spells like Daze and Force of Will to protect its threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan.
